B7B2D4FFAD7F4DA5B035FD750CF438C8.description: Role of language and culture - Understand that language use is shaped by and reflects the values, ideas and norms of a community

940C63B77BF944DAA2D73B3D4086DD6E.description: Language variation and change - Recognise that German and English are related languages and that German is an important European and global language

1D64521F461A40568FDF14ED4CD93400.description: Language variation and change - Recognise some of the common variations in German as it is used in different contexts and locations by different people

FC424BB9CCF74871B2210629DDE3042E.description: Systems of language - Recognise and use structures and other textual features of common spoken, written and multimodal texts such as invitations, emails, surveys, advertisements and music video clips

1A3A51C4CA444677948ABFD15823A5E1.description: Systems of language - Develop knowledge of elements of the German grammatical system, including gender and number, nominative and accusative cases, present tense of regular and some irregular verbs, personal pronouns, possessive adjectives and word order, to describe people, objects, actions, events and relationships

792CCABB0C794E0EA885F53F7C4A3761.description: Systems of language - Recognise and use key features of the German sound system, including pronunciation, rhythm, stress and intonation, and identify main similarities and differences between the phonological and orthographic systems of English and German

F116A3BE543A40B1A5FF9342CC2BFAE3.description: Reflecting - Reflect on experiences of learning and using another language, and share aspects of own identity, such as age, interests and family background, reflecting on how these impact on intercultural exchange

2C23CAE3AC2448BF8C391A7D050C8713.description: Reflecting - Engage with German speakers and texts, noticing how interactions involve culture as well as language

B9284961626A4D6E8A5FF4E5C583FBE7.description: Translating - Create and maintain individual and shared bilingual texts and resources such as signs, word lists, posters, games and photo stories

FD7B38C2915A4D61A74BBDCFC707FFF4.description: Translating - Translate and interpret texts such as greetings, signs, emails and conversations, from German to English and vice versa, noticing similarities and differences

A0E5199DF6294D21B51923F4DBFAE238.description: Creating - Reinterpret or adapt a familiar text and/or use a modelled structure and language to create simple and original imaginative texts

D3A9DE09ECAB4D7BAE4FFE1605ADB437.description: Creating - Engage with imaginative and creative texts by identifying, describing and discussing key elements, including characters, events and ideas

5997FCDB8227495EAC31494DD9FB69E1.description: Informing - Present in modelled spoken and written texts information relating to own world and that of other teenagers

305C7CD9DE1D4D23B39332E427CCB020.description: Informing - Identify topic, gist and specific points of information in a range of simple spoken and written texts relating to own world and that of other teenagers

8F88033E1E294B4C9B616EE130DD2B24.description: Socialising - Participate in classroom routines and exchanges by following instructions, asking and answering questions, apologising and making requests

07525BFF1D4340379BCA84B6AD51A867.description: Socialising - Make plans and arrangements to carry out activities together and obtain goods or services, through transacting with others in simple and guided real or simulated situations

4899557483D34C3A8447A0814D2E143B.description: Socialising - Socialise and interact with teacher and peers to exchange greetings, good wishes, and factual information about self, family, home, school and interests, and express likes, dislikes and preferences
